meanings.definition: The act of guarding or protecting against danger or harm.
meanings.sent1: The warding of the castle walls kept the villagers safe.
meanings.sent2: The knight's warding of the princess was unwavering.
meanings.sent3: The warding of the treasure chest was so strong that even the sneaky thief couldn't get to it.
meanings.sent4: Her love acted as a powerful warding against the darkness in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The warding of the ancient artifact was crucial to preserving its magic.

meanings.definition: A person or group of people under the protection or care of another.
meanings.sent1: The children were under the warding of their kind teacher.
meanings.sent2: The refugees found warding in the compassionate hands of the volunteers.
meanings.sent3: The warding of the lost puppy by the little girl melted everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent4: The warding of the orphaned siblings by their older brother was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The warding of the elderly by the community brought a sense of unity.

meanings.definition: The act of turning away or deflecting something, such as an attack or evil influence.
meanings.sent1: The wizard's warding off the dark magic saved the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The superhero's warding of the city from villains was legendary.
meanings.sent3: The warding of bad luck seemed to work as the day turned out surprisingly well.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a strong warding against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The warding of negative thoughts was like putting up a shield against despair.
